Article Title: With inflation at record low of 0.3%, food ministry proposes lifting of export ban on wheat products
Article Text:
Representative AI image

NEW DELHI: With inflation at a record low of 0.3%, the food ministry has proposed lifting of export restrictions on wheat products such as aata, maida and sooji after a gap of nearly three-and-a-half years. In a letter to the commerce department, it has suggested considering allowing such exports of up to one million tonne (MT).Referring to the representation of Roller Flour Millers’ Federation of India to allow export of wheat products based on the “prevailing surplus and strong production outlook”, the ministry has sought “necessary action”.Sources said the Food Corporation of India (FCI) commenced the open market sale scheme (OMSS) of wheat for bulk buyers such as flour millers and this got a lukewarm response with around 70,000 tonne sold through e-action against the offer 2 lakh tonnes at Rs 2,550 per quintal. They added that this indicates enough wheat availability in the market and even the wholesale prices have dropped by around 12% compared to last year.At present, FCI has around 30.5 MT of wheat stock against the buffer requirement of 20.5 MT for Jan 1, 2026.Navneet Chitlangia, president of Roller Flour Millers’ Federation, said India has witnessed a bumper wheat harvest this season, and with a favourable monsoon, they anticipate yet another excellent harvest in the coming season.“In view of the robust domestic production, we have requested govt to lift the restrictions on wheat product exports so that India may reclaim its traditional markets across the globe,” he said.Before the export ban of wheat products, India used to send shipments of flour, maida and sooji and other products to Africa, Gulf and south Asian countries. In May, a ban was imposed on exports of wheat and its products due to concerns over domestic food security, drop in production, and rising inflation.
Article Summary: With inflation at a record low of 0.3%, the food ministry has proposed lifting of export restrictions on wheat products. In may, a ban was imposed on exports of wheat and its products due to concerns over domestic food security, drop in production, and rising inflation.

Article Title: Citizens can control their digital data as protection law goes live
Article Text:
New rules bar transfer of some data abroad

NEW DELHI: Millions of citizens going online will have guaranteed control over their digital data while social media companies such as Facebook and Instagram will need verifiable parental consent before onboarding children, or those under 18 years, with the govt finally notifying rules to operationalise the digital personal data protection (DPDP) law that was originally passed by Parliament in Aug 2023.The much-awaited rules promise a consent-based regime to safeguard the data of users who go online for social media, e-commerce, gaming, banking, payments and for availing of govt services.Companies and organisations violating the rules will face penalties, up to ₹250cr for serious failures to protect data, and breaches.The rules also require companies to quickly inform users and the new data protection board about any data breach. However, these rules will be implemented gradually.The govt has given companies an 18-month window for transition, considering the big back-end changes they will need to undertake. Any breach must be promptly informed in "plain language, explaining the nature and possible consequences of the breach, the steps taken to address it, and contact details for assistance", the govt said.It also said the law is guided by "seven core principles" - consent and transparency, purpose limitation, data minimisation, accuracy, storage limitation, security safeguards, and accountability.Regarding online data of children, where Big Tech and other major companies had been lobbying for a "liberal" approach, the new law mandates that companies must obtain verifiable consent before processing their personal data, with limited exemptions for essential purposes such as healthcare, education and real-time safety. "For persons with disabilities who cannot make legal decisions even with support, consent must come from a lawful guardian. "To obtain verifiable parental consent for processing a child's personal data, companies must adopt appropriate technical and organisational measures ".
Article Summary: The much-awaited rules promise a consent-based regime to safeguard the data of users who go online for social media, e-commerce, gaming, banking, payments and for availing of govt services. Social media companies such as facebook and instagram will need verifiable parental consent before onboarding children.

Jannik Sinner career and earnings in 2025

Laila Hasanovic modeling career and ventures



Jannik Sinner and Laila Hasanovic recent updates



Jannik Sinner and Laila Hasanovic combined net worth in 2025

Most of this comes from Sinner’s tennis career, while Laila earns from modeling and through her brand work.They are considered one of the most loved young couples in sports and fashion. With Jannik Sinner still winning big tournaments and Laila Hasanovic growing fast in modeling, their combined wealth and popularity are likely to rise even higher in the coming years.

Article Title: Andrew Tate net worth in 2025: Misfits CEO earnings, car collection, kickboxing career and more
Article Text:
Andrew Tate (via Getty Images)

Andrew Tate’s wealth and assets

Andrew Tate’s social media presence

Andrew Tate’s car collection and real estate holdings

Andrew Tate’s kickboxing career

Andrew Tate’s net worth has become one of the most debated topics online. While several platforms estimate his fortune to be around $20-$170 million in 2025, Romanian authorities, however, estimate it closer to $12 million based on seized assets, company records, and digital holdings. This difference has fueled new discussions about Tate’s public claims and real financial status.Tate has always promoted a lavish lifestyle. He flashes luxury cars, watches, and expensive homes online. But official reports reveal a much smaller fortune than what he often claims. Despite this, Tate remains a major online figure with millions who follow his every move.Reports show Andrew Tate owns four companies, 15 luxury cars, 14 high-end watches, and 21 Bitcoins.DIICOT claims these assets form the basis of his $12 million valuation. CelebrityNetWorth places him higher at $20 million. Tate has often described himself as a trillionaire, but no official source supports this. His wealth mainly comes from kickboxing, business ventures, and online subscriptions.Andrew Tate built a huge online following through bold opinions and controversial videos. According to the BBC, “Tate’s War Room” had 434 members in 2022, each paying $8,000 a year.This brought in roughly $3.5 million from memberships alone. His platform, “Hustler’s University”, reportedly has over 100,000 subscribers paying $49.99 a month. His fame increased after bans on TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, and earlier on Twitter, which was restored in 2022.Tate is known for his flashy car collection. He owns a Bugatti Chiron Pur Sport, two Ferrari 812 models, a McLaren 720s, two Lamborghinis, a Rolls-Royce Wraith, and more. Police in Romania later seized several cars, including a McLaren 765LT and a Ferrari 812 Superfast. Tate also has luxury homes in Romania, the US, and the UK. His Romanian residence alone is valued at nearly $2 million, based on social media posts.Andrew Tate began training in kickboxing at the age of 19 in Luton, England. He quickly climbed the ranks and by 2008 was among Britain’s top 10 kickboxers. He won the ISKA English Full-Contact Cruiserweight title and the IKF British Championship in 2009. Tate claimed multiple ISKA World titles in 2011 and 2013. In 2014, he won the Enfusion Live World Championship. His only professional MMA fight took place in 2010, adding to his combat sports résumé.Also Read: Lewis Hamilton vs Charles Leclerc salary comparison in 2025: Which Ferrari star is richer, F1 salary, endorsements, net worth and more
Article Summary: Andrew tate's net worth has become one of the most debated topics online. Several platforms estimate his fortune to be around $20-$170 million in 2025. Romanian authorities, however, estimate it closer to $12 million based on seized assets, company records, and digital holdings.

Article Title: What is Sophie Cunningham’s latest announcement about? All that you need to know about WNBA star’s recent partnership
Article Text:
Image via Getty

Sophie Cunningham announces partnership with a beverage brand, Sun-Cruiser

Image via Sophie Cunningham/Instagram (screengrab)

Also Read:

A pace car driver, a golfer and now a new partnership with a beverage brand, Sophie Cunningham is doing it all. The athlete’s offseason seems to be going pretty well. On November 13, Sophie kicked off a partnership with Sun Cruiser, a fast-growing vodka iced tea brand at Rocco’s Sports & Rec. The WNBA star made the announcement through her Instagram. She posted pictures from the kick-off party, making the partnership official.Sun Cruiser had already announced the partnership with Sophie days back. The brand will sponsor her offseason. It is quite interesting how Sophie manages to balance both her on-court and off-court lives. The athlete believes that when she is not busy getting dunks and scores for her team, she needs to live life and make it count. With this new brand sponsoring her off-season, Sophie seems really excited for the upcoming days.Sophie Cunningham looks super excited about this new partnership with Sun Cruiser. She posted a series of stories that provided glimpses from the off-season kick-off party. While initially it was all reposts from the stories of different individuals who had mentioned her, Sophie started posting pictures with her own captions.As general information for her fans and supporters, Sophie wrote, “Sooooo ICYMI [In Case You Missed It] I joined the @drinkcruiser fam. ” followed by a series of emojis. The WNBA star was, however, careful about the age restriction mentioned by the brand. She added, “#ad must be 21+.”Even the official website of the drink does not let a user in if the age is not 21+. The next story was the official announcement of the partnership with the brand. Sophie wrote, “We kicked off our partnership with drinks, hoops and good times at @gotoroccos last night. @drinkcruiser #ad must be 21+.” The WNBA star could be seen holding a can of the drink and sitting on the bar counter, posing for the camera.In the next story, Sophie talked about the authenticity of the beverage brand. She wrote, “No bubbles, real vodka and real tea? Say less. @drinkcruiser #ad must be 21+. You can thank me later for putting you on your new favorite drink.”The partnership seems really exciting for the athlete. Sophie’s Sun-Cruiser designed offseason is to get the player outside, have fun and cheers with her friends and peers. As the partnership kicks off, fans can expect fun stories from the athlete’s off-season.
Article Summary: Sophie cunningham announces partnership with a beverage brand, sun-cruiser. The wnba star made the announcement through her instagram. She posted pictures from the kick-off party, making the partnership official.sun cruiser had already announced the partnership with sophie days back.

Article Title: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu on Arattai app dropping out of top 100 list: ‘I literally told our employees…’
Article Text:
Vembu: Zoho has long-term strategy









Zoho Corporation founder and CEO Sridhar Vembu has responded to his company's messaging app Arattai falling out of the top 100 apps list, calling it a normal part of business development and dismissing critics as wasting their time. In an interview with ANI, Vembu addressed questions about WhatsApp testing a feature that would allow users to message people on other platforms.“There's nothing going wrong. I think, first of all, the idea that something went wrong is what is wrong. It is a normal course of events. Nothing goes straight to the moon. You have to go through these ups and downs,” Vembu was quoted as saying.He emphasised that companies that survive maintain a long-term perspective.“The trick to companies that survive is they have a long-term view on this. In fact, I never thought The number one is anything big. In fact, I literally told our employees, this is a particular moment, it won't last,” he added.“That's why I simply don't pay attention. And the people who pay attention and making fun of this, they are wasting their time. That's all I'll say. We are not wasting time. I am sitting and we are sitting and focused on code.So I said, don't worry about it,” Vembu noted, pointing out that Zoho views Arattai as a five to 15-year project rather than a short-term venture.Vembu revealed that Zoho has worked on messaging technology for 10 years, making the recent ranking drop insignificant.“Our strategy in all this, the messaging is very core. And we have been working on it for 10 years. So this one month is nothing for us. We will continue this and we have a really strong app. It's getting stronger,” the cofounder was quoted as saying.The company plans frequent updates to improve Arattai. Vembu argued that credible competition is necessary to prevent monopolistic practices in the messaging app market.“If we don't have competition, you can't keep the monopolist honest. The only thing that keeps a monopolist honest is competition,” he said.While talking about end-to-end encryption of chats on Arattai, Vembu noted that the encryption feature has been implemented, however, it will take some more time for the updates to take effect.
Article Summary: Vembu: zoho has long-term strategy for messaging app arattai. Company plans frequent updates to improve the app. Vembu argued that credible competition is necessary to prevent monopolistic practices in the messaging app market. He added that the people who pay attention and making fun of this, they are wasting their time.

Article Title: Valve unveils Steam Machine console: Features and other details
Article Text:
Image credit: X (Twitter)

Valve Steam Machine price and release date





Announcing: New

@Steam Hardware, coming in 2026: Steam Controller, Steam Machine, Steam Frame. Watch our jazzy announcement video and wishlist now: http://steampowered.com/hardware."

Valve Steam Machine console: Key highlights

Category Details CPU AMD Zen 4 (6 cores / 12 threads, up to 4.8GHz) GPU Custom AMD RDNA 3 (28 compute units, 8GB GDDR6 VRAM) RAM 16GB DDR5 (upgradeable) Storage NVMe SSD (512GB or 2TB), expandable via slot or microSD Performance 4K 60FPS gaming with FSR upscaling and ray tracing; ~6x more power than Steam Deck; handles titles like Cyberpunk 2077 and Starfield smoothly Connectivity HDMI 2.0, DisplayPort 1.4, Wi-Fi 6E, Bluetooth, multiple USB ports Steam Library Support Runs full Steam library on SteamOS Windows Game Support Proton compatibility makes most Windows games work seamlessly Supported Titles examples Baldur’s Gate 3, Counter-Strike 2, Elden Ring Software Flexibility Supports other OSs, game launchers, and emulators Peripherals Support Works with most controllers and accessories; new Steam Controller integrates cleanly





Valve has officially announced a new video-game console -- Stream Machine, designed to bring PC gaming to the living room. Set to launch in 2026, the Steam Machine blends console convenience with PC-grade performance, offering gamers a fresh alternative to traditional platforms like PlayStation and Xbox. The Steam Machine is a cube-shaped compact gaming console which is built to run on Valve’s SteamOS and play games directly from users’ Stream libraries. The gaming console is designed for plug and play use with televisions, making it ideal for gamers who want to experience PC-level performance without a full desktop setup.Valve claims that the Steam Machine is six times more powerful than the Steam Deck. The gaming console is powered by semi-custom AMD Zen 4 CPU ans AMD RDNA3 GPU. Steam Machine also support 4K gaming at 60 FPS with FSR (FidelityFX Super Resolution). The gaming console packs 16GB of RAM and 8GB of GDDR6 VRAM. The company is giving two storage options for Steam Machine which includes — 512GB and 2TB.Valve has also announced that the Stream Machine console will come with a revised Steam Controller which will offer improved ergonomics and haptic feedback. Along with this, Valve has also teased the Steam Frame which is a new VR headset designed to play both virtual and reality titles and standard Steam games on a virtual 2D screen.The Steam Machine is scheduled to launch in 2026, though Valve has not yet confirmed a specific release month or pricing. It will be available both as a standalone console and in bundles with the Steam Controller.Valve also said that the Steam Machine is built for modularity and portability, with a form factor small enough to fit under a TV or in a travel bag. The company also claims that the gaming console is designed to for gamers who want high-end performance without the complexity of building or maintaining a gaming PC.To announce the new hardware, the company took to social media platofrm X and wrote: "Here are the key specs, features, software support and other detials of the upcoming Valve Steam Machine console:
Article Summary: Valve has officially announced a new video-game console -- stream machine, designed to bring pc gaming to the living room. Set to launch in 2026, the steam machine blends console convenience with pc-grade performance. The gaming console is powered by semi-custom amd zen 4 cpu ans amd rdna3 gpu.

Article Title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang to Mark Zuckerberg: I would have dropped out of college, if I had known …
Article Text:
Mutual admiration and playful banter

Microsoft’s AI Bet Pays Off: Company Joins Nvidia in $4 Trillion Club

Nvidia’s journey from $200 startup to $5 trillion company

Mark Zuckerberg’s dorm room to trillion-dollar empire

Nvidia Makes History: First Company to Hit $4 Trillion Market Cap





Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang and Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg took the stage for a candid and humours conversation. The tech titans shared their thoughts on the future on generative AI and the long road to building tech empires. In a lighthearted moment, Huang joked that if he had known how long it would take to succeed, the he might have followed Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg’s oath and dropped out of college early. “If I had known it was going to take so long to succeed… I would've dropped out of college just like you,” Huang quipped, drawing laughter from the audience and Zuckerberg himself.The discussion involving Huang and Zuckerberg spanned around decades of innovation. The discussion started with Zuckerberg praising Huang’s role in powering the AI revolution. “It’s all you—you kind of made this happen,” Zuckerberg said, referring to Nvidia’s dominance in AI infrastructure.Responding to Zuckerberg, Jensen Huang said, “Why thank you… CEOs, we're delicate flowers,” poking fun at the need for appreciation even at the top.Along with this, the two tech leaders also joked about aging and appearances.“We’re pretty grizzled at this point,” Zuckerberg said. “I think we’re the two longest-standing founders in the industry.” Huang agreed, noting his gray hair while Zuckerberg commented on his curls.Huang founded Nvidia in 1993 with just the investment of $200. He launched the company on his 30th birthday which was later joined by co-founders Chris Malachowsky and Curtis Priem. Nvidia started with a mission to advance 3D graphics. The breakthrough came in 1999 with the invention of the GPU, a technology that transformed computing.Fast forward to October 2025, Nvidia has entered the $5 trillion club. The chip maker managed to reach the market valuation of $5 trillion in just three months after crossing $ 4 trillion. This growth in Nvidia's market value suggest the escalating momentum in AI adoption across industries. Shares of Nvidia rose more than 4%, pushing its market capitalisation. Nvidia ranks ahead of Microsoft ($4 trillion) and Apple ($3.9 trillion), as well as Google parent Alphabet ($3.2 trillion), Amazon ($2.4 trillion) and Meta ($1.8 trillion).Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg’s journey started from his dorm room in Harvard in 2004, from where he started Facebook . He famously dropped out in 2005 to focus on the company, turning down his father’s offer to invest in a McDonald’s franchise. Today, Meta is valued at $1.6 trillion.
Article Summary: Nvidia ceo jensen huang and meta ceo mark zuckerberg took the stage for a candid and humours conversation. The tech titans shared their thoughts on the future on generative ai and the long road to building tech empires. Huang joked that if he had known how long it would take to succeed, the he might have followed meta's oath and dropped out of college early.

Article Title: 5 months after Mark Zuckerberg shocked the tech industry by hiring ScaleAI's founder and many top employees; company's CFO has a message: We are ...
Article Text:
Image courtesy: LinkedIn

Scale AI CFO pushes back: “We are alive and well”





Mark Zuckerberg unveils three new Meta AI smart glasses

Business is still booming





Moving ahead without Alexandr Wang





Facebook-parent Meta stunned the Silicon Valley in June this year by announcing a $14.3 billion investment in AI startup — Scale AI. Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg made this investment to primarily onboard Scale AI founder Alexandr Wang and other top executives of the company. This move by Meta trigged an immediate speculation about the Scale AI’s viability, with major clients like OpenAI, Google, and Elon Musk’s xAI reportedly pausing work with the startup. The industry insiders also felt that the company had been effectively acquired, leaving its future uncertain. However, after almost five months after the investment made by Meta, Scale AI CFO Dennis Cinelli has pushed back this speculation. Speaking to CNBC in an interview, Cinelli said that ‘We are a company that signed some of the best deals we have had in the history of our company, just in the last two or three months. We are not a Zombie.”Emphasising on the fact that Scale AI has signed some of its best deals in recent months, Cinelli told CNBC, “We’re not a zombie company,”. Along with this, he also dismissed the claims that the investment made by Meta was a licensing or acquihire deal.He emphasised that Scale AI is still an independent and completely operational.Founded in 2016, ScaleAI is known for its data-labelling services and custom AI applications for governments and enterprises. Cinelli told CNBC that both the divisions of the company are growing with revenue “well into the nine figures.” He also revealed that Scale AI recently secured two major contracts with the US Department of Defense which value $99 million and $100 million in August and September, respectively.Scale AI fired about 14% of its workforce in July, soon after Meta made the investment of $14.3 billion, but the company started the process of hiring and has hired 200 new employees. Along with this, the AI company is also working on expansion and is opening new offices in New York, Washington D.C., St. Louis, and London. Despite alls this, the San Francisco still remains the largest hub of the company where it is occupying 180,000 square feet of former Airbnb space.The departure of Alexandr Wang from the company was considered to a major loss. He was the world’s youngest self-made billionaire until October but Cinelli insists the “vast majority” of employees remain. Facebook-parent Meta now owns 49% stake in ScaleAIwhich is valued around $29 billion, but the company has no voting power or product integration. “Scale’s data business has grown every month since the Meta deal, and its applications business has doubled in the second half of 2025 compared with the first half. Scale expects the applications unit to be the primary revenue driver for the company in the future,” Cenelli told CNBC.
Article Summary: Scale ai cfo pushes back: “we are alive and well” facebook-parent meta made a $14.3 billion investment in ai startup scale ai. The move by meta trigged an immediate speculation about the scale ai’s viability. The industry insiders felt that the company had been effectively acquired.

Article Title: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath on SEBI notice on Digital Gold: Safest and easiest ways to get exposure to Gold is ...
Article Text:
‘Gold ETFs remain one of the safest and easiest to invest in gold’



SEBI’s advisory in digital gold



Read SEBI’s advisory here:



SEBI has enabled investments in gold and gold related instruments through various SEBI regulated gold products. These are exchange traded commodity derivative contracts, Gold Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs) offered by Mutual Funds and Electronic Gold Receipts (EGRs) tradeable on stock exchanges. Investments in these SEBI regulated gold products can be made through SEBI registered intermediaries and are governed by the regulatory framework prescribed by SEBI.

It has come to the notice of SEBI that some digital/online platforms are offering investors to invest in "Digital Gold/E-Gold Products'. Digital Gold is being marketed as an alternative for investment in physical gold.

In this context, it is informed that such digital gold products are different from SEBI regulated gold products as they are neither notified as securities nor regulated as commodity derivatives. They operate entirely outside the purview of SEBI. Such digital gold products may entail significant risks for investors and may expose investors to counterparty and operational risks.

Investors/ participants are made aware that none of the investor protection mechaims under securities market purview shall be available for investments in such Digital Gold/ E-Gold products.





Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath has now issued a cautionary note for the investors following SEBI’s recent advisory on digital gold. For those unaware, earlier this week SEBI issued a an advisory on digital gold calling it an unregulated and inefficient way to gain exposureto the precious metal. Now Kamath shared a post of social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) advising the users to not to go after digital gold and instead opt for the one of the safest and easiest ways — gold ETFs if they want to inset in gold. “Most people don’t realize that nobody regulates digital gold, and if something were to happen to the platforms or companies selling it, there’s not much you can do,” wrote Kamath.In a post shared on X, Kamath emphasised that digital gold is not regulated by any financial authority, which means that investors have limited recourse if the platforms selling it collapse or default. He noted that most buyers are unaware of this regulatory gap. “Most people don’t realize that nobody regulates digital gold, and if something were to happen to the platforms or companies selling it, there’s not much you can do,” Kamath wrote.Along with this, Kamath also pointed out the high upfront costs associated with digital gold purchases such as a 3% GST, plus 2–3% in spreads, which in tern means that the investors will lose another 6% immediately after buying digital gold, even before the regulatory risks kick in.Kamath also said that with Sovereign Gold Bonds going away, the only safest and easiest way to invest in gold is through gold exchange-traded funds (ETFs). “Now that Sovereign Gold Bonds (SGBs) have stopped, gold ETFs remain one of the safest and easiest ways to get exposure to gold,’ Kamath.The remarks made by Kamath align with the Securities and Exchange Board of India’s (SEBI) recent warning about the risks of investing in digital gold. SEBI cautioned that these products are not covered under its regulatory framework and urged investors to exercise due diligence.
Article Summary: Zerodha ceo nithin kamath has issued a cautionary note for the investors following sebi’s recent advisory on digital gold. ‘most people don’t realize that nobody regulates digital gold, and if something were to happen to the platforms or companies selling it, there's not much you can do,’ wrote kamath.

If you’re finding today’s NYT Strands puzzle tricky, you’re in good company. Strands, a popular word game among fans of Wordle and Connections, challenges players to spot hidden words in a six-by-eight letter grid, all linked by a common theme. Its mix of strategy and wordplay makes it both engaging and satisfying for puzzle enthusiasts.One of the most exciting aspects of the game is the Spangram, a special word that uses all the letters in the grid. Discovering the Spangram is often the key to completing the puzzle and uncovering the theme. For 14 November 2025, we’ve gathered today’s answers, Spangram, and hints, along with tips to improve your word-finding skills and make your gameplay more enjoyable.NYT Strands is part of The New York Times’ expanding online Games collection. The game requires players to link letters in a six-by-eight grid to create words connected by a shared theme. Each puzzle provides a theme hint, and the Spangram serves as a crucial tool for solving the grid. This special word may run horizontally, vertically, or diagonally across the grid, revealing the puzzle’s theme and helping players complete it efficiently.Strands combines critical thinking and vocabulary knowledge, offering a rewarding challenge for word game enthusiasts.Today’s Strands puzzle theme is “.”For today’s NYT Strands puzzle on 14 November 2025, the Spangram is vertical, running from top to bottom. OnePlus 15 is here. OnePlus has launched its flagship smartphone OnePlus 15 in India. The high-end smartphone is powered by Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 chipset and is backed by a 7,300 mAh battery. The company says that the OnePlus 15 integrates “powerful performance, a professional-grade camera system, practical and personalised AI capabilities, and a refined iconic design.” OnePlus 15 also features 6.78-inch 1.5K AMOLED display and houses a triple 50MP rear camera setup with a telephoto lens and an ultrawide lens. A 32MP front camera handles selfies and video calls. The handset carries IP66, IP68, IP69 and IP69K dust and water resistance ratings.The OnePlus 15 is priced at Rs 72,999 for the 12GB + 256GB variant and Rs 79,999 for the 16GB + 512GB model. The smartphone will complete against the recently launched iPhone 17. Apple iPhone 17 houses a 6.3-inch (2622×1206 pixels) OLED Super Retina XDR display and is powered by Apple’s own A19 chipset. The smartphone runs iOS 26 and comes with IP68 rating. The price of Apple iPhone 17 starts at Rs 82,900. So, if you are planning to purchase a high-end flagship smartphone and confused between the two, then take a loot at the complete spec-by-spec comparison of OnePlus 16 and Apple iPhone 17.
Article Summary: Oneplus 15 has been launched in india. It has a 6.78-inch 1.5k amoled display and houses a triple 50mp rear camera setup with a telephoto lens and an ultrawide lens. The high-end smartphone is powered by snapdragon 8 elite gen 5 chipset and is backed by a 7,300 mah battery.

Article Title: Apple releases new iPhone Pocket accessory starting at Rs 13,000: What it is, how it works, and where to buy
Article Text:
iPhone Pocket

What is iPhone Pocket





iPhone Pocket: Two strap styles, colourways and sizing options





iPhone Pocket functionality: What it holds and how it’s used





iPhone Pocket pricing and availability





Model / Strap length US Price (USD) India Price (Rs) Availability: Online and select stores (initial markets) Short strap design (8 colours) $149.95 ₹12,900* On sale from Friday, 14 November 2025 at select Apple Store locations and on apple.com in France, China, Italy, Japan, Singapore, South Korea, the UK, and the US. Long strap design (3 colours) $229.95 ₹20,300* Same launch date and markets as above. Apple Specialists will assist with styling in-store.

*Conversion approximations for India based on industry reports: short strap = ₹12,900; long strap = ₹20,300.

(Note: Prices in India are approximate conversions from USD and reported by independent media.

Apple has not published an official Indian price or launch date for this accessory at the time of writing.)

iPhone Pocket manufacturing and collaboration background





Styling, use cases and pairing of iPhone Pocket with Apple devices





iPhone Pocket care, durability and expected user experience





How Apple positions iPhone Pocket in its product ecosystem





Retail experience and purchase process at launch









Apple and Japanese fashion house ISSEY MIYAKE have jointly introduced iPhone Pocket, a 3D-knitted textile accessory designed to be worn or carried and to hold an iPhone plus other small everyday items. The product is described as a “piece of cloth” reimagined as a flexible pocket: its ribbed, open-knit fabric expands to enclose a device and lets users glimpse the display when stretched. iPhone Pocket is available in two strap lengths and multiple colours, and Apple frames it as a special-edition accessory that complements iPhone design and personal style. The launch is positioned as both a fashion collaboration and a product engineered for universal fit and everyday utility.iPhone Pocket is a singular, 3D-knitted construction developed by ISSEY MIYAKE in close collaboration with Apple Design Studio. Crafted in Japan, the textile draws inspiration from the brand’s iconic pleats and is intended to function as an additional, wearable pocket for iPhone and other “pocketable items” such as AirPods. The knit’s ribbed open structure allows the textile to expand and subtly reveal contents when stretched, while fully enclosing items when relaxed.Apple and ISSEY MIYAKE describe the material as engineered for both look and function, combining traditional craft with modern textile R&D.iPhone Pocket is a singular, 3D-knitted construction developed by ISSEY MIYAKE in close collaboration with Apple Design Studio. Crafted in Japan, the textile draws inspiration from the brand’s iconic pleats and is intended to function as an additional, wearable pocket for iPhone and other “pocketable items” such as AirPods. The knit’s ribbed open structure allows the textile to expand and subtly reveal contents when stretched, while fully enclosing items when relaxed. Apple and ISSEY MIYAKE describe the material as engineered for both look and function, combining traditional craft with modern textile R&D.According to Apple, the iPhone Pocket is sized and structured to fit any iPhone model as well as small everyday items. The open knit expands to accommodate slightly bulkier contents and lets users peek at the iPhone display without removing the phone fully. Apple highlights multiple ways to use the accessory: handheld, attached to a bag, or worn on the body. The product is positioned as a fashion accessory as much as a utility item, emphasising styling and personal expression alongside practical carrying.Apple’s Newsroom states the iPhone Pocket was crafted in Japan and that its development and design unfolded through collaboration between ISSEY MIYAKE’s research and development teams and Apple Design Studio. The piece references ISSEY MIYAKE’s longstanding practice of pleating and textile innovation as the inspiration for the accessory’s knit structure. Apple quotes design leads from both organisations to underline the shared approach to simplicity, craftsmanship and adaptability.Apple positions iPhone Pocket as both fashion and function: the open knit and colour palette were explicitly selected to mix and match with iPhone finishes and to let users create personal combinations. Apple images show Pocket paired with iPhone 17, iPhone 17 Pro and iPhone Air models in complementary colours. Practical use cases emphasised by Apple include carrying the iPhone and small items together, wearing the Pocket across the body for hands-free use, and tying it to other bags or accessories. Retail staff will assist customers in stores in selecting strap length and colour combinations.Apple’s announcement emphasises the crafted textile quality and the 3D-knitted construction, but does not publish a formal care guide in the Newsroom piece. Because iPhone Pocket is a textile accessory made in Japan using ISSEY MIYAKE’s knit techniques, consumers should expect typical fabric care considerations gentle handling, avoiding sharp objects, and following any care instructions included in product packaging or on Apple’s online product pages after purchase. For definitive care and warranty details, customers should consult Apple’s product page or in-store specialists at launch.Apple frames iPhone Pocket as a special-edition accessory that complements iPhone design language and expands how users carry and style their devices. The product is intended to sit alongside Apple’s existing accessory portfolio rather than replace protective cases: it emphasises wearability, textile design, and aesthetic pairing. Apple highlights the accessory’s ability to carry other small items (for example, AirPods) and to visually coordinate with iPhone finishes.Apple’s announcement lists the specific Apple Store locations where iPhone Pocket will be available at launch and notes that both online and in-store purchase options will be offered beginning November 14, 2025. Apple Specialists will help customers mix and match lengths and colours with their iPhone and demonstrate styling options. Customers outside the initial launch markets should monitor apple.com for availability updates.
Article Summary: Iphone pocket is a 3d-knitted textile accessory designed to be worn or carried and to hold an iphone plus other small everyday items. The product is described as a “piece of cloth” reimagined as a flexible pocket. Its ribbed, open-knit fabric expands to enclose a device and lets users glimpse the display when stretched.

Article Title: ‘We've proudly called Texas home for 15 years’, says Google CEO Sundar Pichai announcing $40 billion investment in Texas
Article Text:
Google’s $40 billion investment in Texas





Google has announced a $40 billion investment in Texas through 2027, marking one of its largest US infrastructure commitments to date. The funds, the company said will go toward building new cloud and AI infrastructure, including new data center campuses in Armstrong County and Haskell County. Google CEO shared an online post, announcing the investment. “Today, we're announcing a new $40B investment in Texas through 2027 to build Cloud & AI infrastructure and support thousands of new jobs,” he wrote in the post.“This includes new data centers in Armstrong and Haskell Counties and a major investment to strengthen energy resilience and abundance. We're also providing funding to more than double the projected pipeline of new Texan electricians to power the AI era,” he added.“We've proudly called Texas home for 15 years. Thank you @GregAbbott_TX for your continued support,” Pichai continued.As part of the $40 billion investment, Google said it will continue its approach of growing infrastructure responsibly, which includes adding new clean energy resources to the Texas grid and covering the costs tied to its operations. The company also announced a new $30 million Energy Impact Fund to help scale community energy-efficiency projects across the state.Google also confirmed it has secured more than 6,200 megawatts of new energy generation and capacity through power-purchase agreements with energy developers. One of the new Haskell County data centers will be built alongside a solar and battery storage plant, reinforcing the company’s push toward cleaner, more reliable energy resources.In order to support construction of the new facilities, Google will help expand Texas’ pool of skilled electrical workers. In partnership with the electrical training ALLIANCE, the company will help train existing electricians and more than 1,700 apprentices by 2030, more than doubling the state’s expected pipeline of new electricians.Google said the investment is meant not only to bolster Texas’ workforce and infrastructure, but to help ensure the U.S. maintains “the technical backbone to lead the world in AI.”
Article Summary: Google has announced a $40 billion investment in texas through 2027. The funds, the company said will go toward building new cloud and ai infrastructure, including new data center campuses in armstrong county and haskell county. In order to support construction of the new facilities, google will help expand texas’ pool of skilled electrical workers.
